sections.content: You've learned to budget, save, and protect your money. Now it's time for the most exciting part: making your money work FOR you. This is where your savings stop sitting still and start growing â€” even while you sleep.

Albert Einstein reportedly called compound interest 'the eighth wonder of the world.' Here's why:

Imagine you save $50/week and earn 7% annual returns (the historical stock market average). After 1 year, you have $2,725. Nice. But after 10 years? $37,500. After 20 years? $113,000. After 30 years? $264,000.

You only put in $78,000 of your own money over 30 years. The other $186,000? That's compound interest â€” your money earning money on its money.

The key ingredient is TIME. The earlier you start, the more compound interest works in your favour. A 25-year-old who saves $50/week until 60 will have MORE money than a 35-year-old who saves $100/week until 60. Starting early beats saving more, every single time.

Before you invest a single dollar, make sure you have:

âœ… Your $500 Starter Emergency Fund (Level 2)
âœ… No high-interest debt (above 8%)
âœ… A budget you're comfortable with (Level 1)

Once those are ticked, you're ready. And investing doesn't need to be complicated. A simple index fund â€” which automatically buys a little piece of hundreds of companies â€” is how most millionaires invest. Seriously.
